meanings.definition: Swelling caused by fluid retention in body tissues.
meanings.sent1: The oedemata in her ankles made it hard for her to walk.
meanings.sent2: After the injury, his leg showed signs of oedemata.
meanings.sent3: The oedemata in the balloon made it look like it was about to burst!
meanings.sent4: The city's oedemata of traffic during rush hour was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The oedemata in the sponge soaked up all the water in no time.

meanings.sent1: The doctor discussed the oedemata of the patients' legs.
meanings.sent2: In the medical report, it mentioned the presence of oedemata.
meanings.sent3: The oedemata of books on the shelf was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The oedemata of clouds in the sky signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The garden displayed an oedemata of colorful flowers in full bloom.
